customers_db¶

customers_db.py¶

This module handles all customer-related operations, such as registration, wallet management, and updates.

Customers.customers_db.charge_customer_wallet(username, amount)[source]¶

Charges a customer’s wallet by adding a specified amount.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username of the customer.

  • amount (float) – The amount to add to the wallet.

Returns:

True if successful, False if the customer is not found or an error occurs.

Return type:

bool

Customers.customers_db.connect_to_db()[source]¶
Customers.customers_db.create_customers_table()[source]¶

Create the Customers table if it does not exist.

Customers.customers_db.deduct_customer_wallet(username, amount)[source]¶

Deducts a specified amount from a customer’s wallet.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username of the customer.

  • amount (float) – The amount to deduct from the wallet.

Returns:

True if successful, False if the customer is not found, insufficient balance, or an error occurs.

Return type:

bool

Customers.customers_db.delete_customer(username)[source]¶

Deletes a customer by username.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the customer to delete.

Returns:

True if the customer was deleted, False if no customer was found.

Return type:

bool

Customers.customers_db.get_all_customers()[source]¶

Retrieves all customers from the database.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries, each representing a customer.

Return type:

list

Customers.customers_db.get_customer_by_username(username)[source]¶

Retrieves a customer by their username.

Parameters:

username (str) – The unique username of the customer.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the customer’s details, or None if not found.

Return type:

dict

Customers.customers_db.register_customer(customer)[source]¶

Registers a new customer in the Customers table.

Parameters:

customer (dict) – A dictionary containing customer details.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the inserted customer’s details, or an empty dictionary if an error occurred.

Return type:

dict

Customers.customers_db.update_customer(username, updates)[source]¶

Updates one or more fields of a customer by username.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username of the customer to update.

  • updates (dict) – A dictionary containing the fields to update and their new values.

Returns:

True if the customer was updated, False if no customer was found.

Return type:

bool
